details: As a Junior Software Engineer at MBO Partners, I collaborate closely with the engineering team to develop and maintain full-stack web applications, using React for the frontend, and Python for the backend.
I also play a big role in a major platform overhaul, developing in-house tools that enhance both functionality and user experience.
Additionally, I lead the development and troubleshooting of a dynamic pricing tool, automating rate calculations and invoice generation while ensuring alignment with customized client guidelines.
During my internship at Mobiblanc in Casablanca, Morocco, I developed a modular AI customer support bot using DialogFlow on Google Cloud.
This bot was implemented across seven web pages using HTML and JavaScript, enabling efficient handling of user inquiries.
I connected the bot to two MySQL databases: one that it used to automatically respond to user questions and another that captured new inquiries for the team to address.
This solution improved operational efficiency by decreasing wait times by over 70% and reducing costs by 45% while managing an average of 4,700 daily interactions and processing 130 daily inquiries.
In 2020, I was elected Research Director of the Fordham Computer Science Society. I was in charge of most of the weekly tech events organized by the Eboard, and researching the topics discussed.
I was also in charge of keeping track of the club's inventory and leading a year-long research project.
Serving as VP at the Google Developers Student Club, I lead the planning and execution of initiatives, ensuring a robust and purposeful approach to our tech-focused endeavors.
From workshops to competitive coding events, I meticulously organize and execute activities, creating engaging experiences that contribute to the club's vibrant atmosphere.
Part-time position at Fordham IT's help desk, in which I assist members of the Fordham community with any of their tech issues, either in person or remotely.
I've learned to troubleshoot the various problems from the different scenarios I encountered, strengthening my skills and understanding of how the backend works.
This position also required constant interactions with IT specialists, supervisors, and other employees from different departments, thus improving my communication skills.
